intro: Discaria pauciflora, commonly known as the small-flowered discaria, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky areas. Discaria pauciflora is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial in certain ecological contexts.
